repnme.cdata!:
Nigeria - Second Adaptable Program Loan
            (APL) for the West and Central Africa Air Transport Safety
            and Security Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome for the Second
            Adaptable Program Loan (APL) for the West and Central Africa
            Air Transport Safety and Security Project for Nigeria was
            moderately satisfactory. The risk to development outcome was
            substantial; the Bank's performance was moderately
            satisfactory; and the borrower's performance was
            moderately satisfactory. The overall outcome is rated
            moderately satisfactory, due to: (a) the relevance of the
            project development objective and project design and
            implementation to the Bank's current country
            partnership strategy and regional integration assistance
            strategy, national, regional, and global priorities; (b) the
            moderately satisfactory achievement of the project
            development objective; and (c) the satisfactory efficiency
            of the project. The project development objective was not
            revised at any time during project implementation and the
            key indicators and components remained unchanged. Other
            significant changes included Closing date was extended twice
            and government-funded activities were however not carried
            out under the project, but they were implemented, with some
            adjustments, using parastatal agency funding. Another
            significant change was the declaration of misprocurement for
            the acquisition of two ILS/VOR/DME6 systems. Lessons learned
            in relation to project preparation and design are the
            following: 1) need to adequately address in project design
            the lack of managerial autonomy of beneficiary entities; 2)
            political economy context; 3) flexibility in a dynamic
            environment; 4) do not underestimate bureaucratic processing
            timeline; 5) need for robust procurement assessments and
            technical assistance to ensure that project activities can
            be procured efficiently and in a timely fashion; and 6) need
            to simplify project design in a complex and challenging
            implementation environment.

repnme.cdata!:
Nigeria - Second Phase of the West and
            Central Africa Air Transport Safety and Security Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Second
            Phase of the West and Central Africa Air Transport Safety
            and Security Project as originally stated and approved in
            2008 is 'to support the recipient in improving
            compliance of its civil aviation authority and principal
            international airports with International Civil Aviation
            Organization (ICAO) safety and security standards. The
            proposed extension is necessary to allow: the continuation
            of previously scheduled activities that are under
            procurement process and will consolidate safety and security
            concerns (such as the acquisition and installation of
            closed-circuit television for Abuja and Lagos international
            airport) and the completion of the acquisition and
            installation of equipment that have been previously defined
            after design studies financed by the project for some
            parastatal agencies; and the possible review of the priority
            activities if the Government agrees to do so. The closing
            date of the project will be extended from June 30, 2012
            until May 31, 2013.This will be the second extension of the
            second phase of the project for Nigeria, as the project has
            already been extended for a total of 12 months.

Nigeria - Second Phase of the
            West and Central Africa Air Transport Safety and Security
            Project : restructuring (Vol. 2) : Data sheet

repnme.cdata!:
Nigeria - Second Phase of the West and
            Central Africa Air Transport Safety and Security Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Second
            Phase of the West and Central Africa Air Transport Safety
            and Security Project as originally stated and approved in
            2008 is 'to support the recipient in improving
            compliance of its civil aviation authority and principal
            international airports with International Civil Aviation
            Organization (ICAO) safety and security standards. The
            closing date of the project will be extended from June 30,
            2011, until June 30, 2013. This will be the first extension
            of the second phase of the project, for Nigeria. The
            extension is necessary to allow: completion of on-going
            contracts related to the implementation of key activities
            which should contribute to the project development
            objectives' achievement; and enhancement of air
            transport safety and security, by allowing the recipient to
            re-align the activities they wish to finance with adjusted
            priorities, with the inclusion on a sixth parastatal agency
            involved in air transport safety: the Nigeria Meteorological
            Agency (NIMET). This will be the first extension of the
            second phase of the project, for Nigeria.
